location: On board POMPEYs galley, off Misenum.

lines.text: Music plays. Enter two or three Servants with a banquet

lines.speaker: first servant
lines.text: Here theyll be, man. Some o their plants are illrooted already: the least wind i the world will blow them down.

lines.speaker: second servant
lines.text: Lepidus is highcoloured.

lines.speaker: first servant
lines.text: They have made him drink almsdrink.

lines.speaker: second servant
lines.text: As they pinch one another by the disposition, he cries out No more reconciles them to his entreaty, and himself to the drink.

lines.speaker: first servant
lines.text: But it raises the greater war between him and his discretion.

lines.speaker: second servant
lines.text: Why, this is to have a name in great mens fellowship: I had as lief have a reed that will do me no service as a partisan I could not heave.

lines.speaker: first servant
lines.text: To be called into a huge sphere, and not to be seen to move int, are the holes where eyes should be, which pitifully disaster the cheeks.
A sennet sounded. Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, MARK  ANTONY, LEPIDUS, POMPEY, AGRIPPA, MECAENAS, DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS, MENAS, with other captains

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: [To OCTAVIUS CAESAR]  Thus do they, sir: they take the flow o the Nile By certain scales i the pyramid they know, By the height, the lowness, or the mean, if dearth Or foison follow: the higher Nilus swells, The more it promises: as it ebbs, the seedsman Upon the slime and ooze scatters his grain, And shortly comes to harvest.

lines.speaker: lepidus
lines.text: Youve strange serpents there.

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: Ay, Lepidus.

lines.speaker: lepidus
lines.text: Your serpent of Egypt is bred now of your mud by the operation of your sun: so is your crocodile.

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: They are so.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Sit,and some wine! A health to Lepidus!

lines.speaker: lepidus
lines.text: I am not so well as I should be, but Ill neer out.

lines.speaker: domitius enobarbus
lines.text: Not till you have slept I fear me youll be in till then.

lines.speaker: lepidus
lines.text: Nay, certainly, I have heard the Ptolemies pyramises are very goodly things without contradiction, I have heard that.

lines.speaker: menas
lines.text: [Aside to POMPEY]  Pompey, a word.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: [Aside to MENAS]                 Say in mine ear: what ist

lines.speaker: menas
lines.text: [Aside to POMPEY]  Forsake thy seat, I do beseech thee, captain, And hear me speak a word.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: [Aside to MENAS]  Forbear me till anon. This wine for Lepidus!

lines.speaker: lepidus
lines.text: What manner o thing is your crocodile

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: It is shaped, sir, like itself and it is as broad as it hath breadth: it is just so high as it is, and moves with its own organs: it lives by that which nourisheth it and the elements once out of it, it transmigrates.

lines.speaker: lepidus
lines.text: What colour is it of

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: Of it own colour too.

lines.speaker: lepidus
lines.text: Tis a strange serpent.

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: Tis so. And the tears of it are wet.

lines.speaker: octavius caesar
lines.text: Will this description satisfy him

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: With the health that Pompey gives him, else he is a very epicure.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: [Aside to MENAS]  Go hang, sir, hang! Tell me of that away! Do as I bid you. Wheres this cup I calld for

lines.speaker: menas
lines.text: [Aside to POMPEY]  If for the sake of merit thou wilt hear me, Rise from thy stool.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: [Aside to MENAS]  I think thourt mad. The matter
Rises, and walks aside

lines.speaker: menas
lines.text: I have ever held my cap off to thy fortunes.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Thou hast served me with much faith. Whats else to say Be jolly, lords.

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: These quicksands, Lepidus, Keep off them, for you sink.

lines.speaker: menas
lines.text: Wilt thou be lord of all the world

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: What sayst thou

lines.speaker: menas
lines.text: Wilt thou be lord of the whole world Thats twice.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: How should that be

lines.speaker: menas
lines.text: But entertain it, And, though thou think me poor, I am the man Will give thee all the world.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Hast thou drunk well

lines.speaker: menas
lines.text: Now, Pompey, I have kept me from the cup. Thou art, if thou darest be, the earthly Jove: Whateer the ocean pales, or sky inclips, Is thine, if thou wilt hat.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Show me which way.

lines.speaker: menas
lines.text: These three worldsharers, these competitors, Are in thy vessel: let me cut the cable And, when we are put off, fall to their throats: All there is thine.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Ah, this thou shouldst have done, And not have spoke ont! In me tis villany In theet had been good service. Thou must know, Tis not my profit that does lead mine honour Mine honour, it. Repent that eer thy tongue Hath so betrayd thine act: being done unknown, I should have found it afterwards well done But must condemn it now. Desist, and drink.

lines.speaker: menas
lines.text: [Aside]  For this, Ill never follow thy palld fortunes more. Who seeks, and will not take when once tis offerd, Shall never find it more.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: This health to Lepidus!

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: Bear him ashore. Ill pledge it for him, Pompey.

lines.speaker: domitius enobarbus
lines.text: Heres to thee, Menas!

lines.speaker: menas
lines.text: Enobarbus, welcome!

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Fill till the cup be hid.

lines.speaker: domitius enobarbus
lines.text: Theres a strong fellow, Menas.
Pointing to the Attendant who carries off LEPIDUS

lines.speaker: menas
lines.text: Why

lines.speaker: domitius enobarbus
lines.text: A bears the third part of the world, man seest not

lines.speaker: menas
lines.text: The third part, then, is drunk: would it were all, That it might go on wheels!

lines.speaker: domitius enobarbus
lines.text: Drink thou increase the reels.

lines.speaker: menas
lines.text: Come.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: This is not yet an Alexandrian feast.

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: It ripens towards it. Strike the vessels, ho Here is to Caesar!

lines.speaker: octavius caesar
lines.text: I could well forbeart. Its monstrous labour, when I wash my brain, And it grows fouler.

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: Be a child o the time.

lines.speaker: octavius caesar
lines.text: Possess it, Ill make answer: But I had rather fast from all four days Than drink so much in one.

lines.speaker: domitius enobarbus
lines.text: Ha, my brave emperor! Shall we dance now the Egyptian Bacchanals, And celebrate our drink
To MARK ANTONY

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Lets hat, good soldier.

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: Come, lets all take hands, Till that the conquering wine hath steepd our sense In soft and delicate Lethe.

lines.speaker: domitius enobarbus
lines.text: All take hands. Make battery to our ears with the loud music: The while Ill place you: then the boy shall sing The holding every man shall bear as loud As his strong sides can volley. THE SONG. Come, thou monarch of the vine, Plumpy Bacchus with pink eyne! In thy fats our cares be drownd, With thy grapes our hairs be crownd: Cup us, till the world go round, Cup us, till the world go round!
Music plays. DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS places them hand in hand

lines.speaker: octavius caesar
lines.text: What would you more Pompey, good night. Good brother, Let me request you off: our graver business Frowns at this levity. Gentle lords, lets part You see we have burnt our cheeks: strong Enobarb Is weaker than the wine and mine own tongue Splits what it speaks: the wild disguise hath almost Antickd us all. What needs more words Good night. Good Antony, your hand.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Ill try you on the shore.

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: And shall, sir gives your hand.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: O Antony, You have my fathers house,But, what we are friends. Come, down into the boat.

lines.speaker: domitius enobarbus
lines.text: Take heed you fall not. Menas, Ill not on shore.
Exeunt all but DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS and MENAS

lines.speaker: menas
lines.text: No, to my cabin. These drums! these trumpets, flutes! what! Let Neptune hear we bid a loud farewell To these great fellows: sound and be hangd, sound out!
Sound a flourish, with drums

lines.speaker: domitius enobarbus
lines.text: Ho! says a Theres my cap.

lines.speaker: menas
lines.text: Ho! Noble captain, come.
Exeunt
